title: Retro low-res styling, Catull-like typography, animated header letters, randomized mom-media sidebar, and rickroll easter egg

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent subtle low-res/early-2010s retro treatment across the single-page UI without harming readability or the existing pink theme.
acceptanceCriteria: The page has a noticeably more low-res/retro treatment than the current version (e.g., pixelation on decorative elements, slightly aliased edges, and/or reduced-smoothness effects), without harming readability or layout stability.
The effect is applied consistently across the single-page experience and does not break the existing pink theme, banner, cards, or footer.

file_operations.description: Add global retro/low-res utilities (e.g., subtle scanline/dither overlay via a non-interactive pseudo-element, slightly harsher/aliased decorative edges, and optional pixelated rendering for decorative images/icons only) while keeping text crisp/readable and preserving existing vibrant pink theme tokens and the footer non-white text exception.

Apply new retro utility classes at the app shell/root and on decorative assets (banner/mascot/badge images) to ensure the low-res treatment is visible but does not affect layout stability or text readability. Use existing shadcn-ui composition (Card/Badge/Button) only; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Set global Catull-style typography (via a free substitute) and update the main heading typography to a more cartoonish display style that still fits the early-2010s aesthetic.
acceptanceCriteria: Body text, headings, and UI text render using the chosen Catull-style font (or a clearly similar free substitute) across the app.
The main header text visually reads as more cartoonish than before, while remaining legible at small sizes.

file_operations.description: Add font loading for a legally usable free Catull-style substitute (site-wide) plus a cartoonish display font (for the main heading) using standard web font loading in the HTML head, without changing the existing tab title.

Update global typography to use the chosen Catull-style substitute for body/headings and a separate display font for the main header (via CSS variables and/or Tailwind base styles), ensuring legibility and preserving the existing pink theme and footer styling exception.
Extend Tailwind fontFamily configuration to expose the new body and display fonts as utilities/classes, keeping existing theme tokens intact.

requirements.summary: Update the on-page main header text to remove underscores and animate each letter with a looping cartoonish jump-and-squash without reflow; keep browser tab title unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: The on-page header no longer shows underscores in the displayed text.
Each character in the displayed header has a visible jump/squash animation (can be staggered per-letter) that loops smoothly and does not cause the header to reflow or shift surrounding elements.

file_operations.description: Replace the header H1 text rendering with a per-character span layout (underscores removed in displayed text) using inline-flex and fixed line-height to prevent layout shift; apply staggered animation delays per character. Use existing shadcn-ui composition only; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add keyframes and utility/classes for the per-letter jump-and-squash loop (transform-only animation to avoid reflow), plus a wrapper style that preserves the existing heading gloss effect while allowing the new display font.

requirements.summary: Add an early-2010s-style sidebar section with multiple small boxes embedding randomized mom-themed cooking/baking YouTube videos using a safe browser-only approach.
acceptanceCriteria: A sidebar (or side column on desktop, stacked section on mobile) contains multiple small boxes with embedded YouTube videos related to moms cooking/baking.
On page load, the set/order of videos is randomized from an internal list so that different visits can show different selections.
The embeds load safely in the browser (no backend required) and the page remains a single-page experience.

file_operations.description: Add a curated internal list of mom-themed cooking/baking YouTube video IDs/URLs and helper utilities to select and shuffle a subset per visit (no runtime scraping; internal list only).

Adjust the main content layout to include a responsive sidebar (desktop side column, mobile stacked) and render multiple video embed cards selected randomly on initial load. Build the small UI boxes using shadcn-ui Card components; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add retro sidebar/card styling helpers to evoke early-2010s UI boxes (e.g., tighter borders, subtle shadows, and slight ‘web 2.0’ chrome) while preserving the existing vibrant pink theme.

requirements.summary: Add an early-2010s-style sidebar section with multiple small randomized mom-written article cards (title, snippet, source link) opening safely in new tabs.
acceptanceCriteria: A sidebar section contains multiple small article cards/boxes with a title, short snippet, and an outbound link.
On page load, the set/order of articles is randomized from an internal list so that different visits can show different selections.
Article links open in a new tab with appropriate rel attributes (noopener/noreferrer).

file_operations.description: Add a curated internal list of mom-written articles (title/snippet/url/source label) and reuse the same shuffle/subset helper for randomized selection per visit.

Render a second sidebar section for article cards (title + snippet + outbound link) using shadcn-ui Card components, ensuring links open in a new tab with rel="noopener noreferrer". Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a rickroll easter egg by making a single visible word clickable that redirects to the specified YouTube URL.
acceptanceCriteria: There is a clearly identifiable single word somewhere in the UI that is clickable.
Clicking the word navigates to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ (either same-tab navigation or opening a new tab is acceptable, but it must clearly redirect to that URL).

file_operations.description: Introduce a single clearly identifiable clickable word in existing UI copy (no new routes/pages) that navigates to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ (same-tab or new-tab allowed) while maintaining the single-page joke experience.
Add a small styling treatment for the rickroll word (e.g., link-like affordance consistent with the retro theme) to make it discoverable without disrupting layout or existing theme tokens.
